task.title: Transforming DITA to Word with Ant script

step.cmd: Specify a directory where you want to put the output files. For example, e:/output/dita2word.
Open an ant script file from the default model template. You can find the file "template_wordrtf.xml" under the "ant" directory.
Modify the transformation type to Word.
step.info: The default file name is "ant.xml". If you want to save the template file, make sure to save it as another file name. For example, antfile.xml.

step.cmd: On the command line, enter ant -f <ant.xml>.
After processing and generating, a single output file in ".rft" format occurs in the specified directory, such as in e:/output/diat2word.
You can use Microsoft Word to open the output file.
You can also further edit the output file by using tools in Microsoft Word.
